result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance B Walker

Defendant Terrance B Walker in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Court is advised that not all discovery has been received.
Court orders trial of June 13 vacated and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 45.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Terrance B Walker in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense counsel requested a final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court scheduled dates with parties. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Terrance B Walker in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-30-2022

Court ordered no contact with C.M.C and Revel Bar, at 2246 S. Kinnickinnic Avenue 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terrance B Walker in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Terrance B Walker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrance B Walker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
